answers.answer: You may not get sick at all! Here's hoping! :-)Everyone is so different. I'm beginning to get sensitive to smells (usually the smell of corn doesn't bother me, but I gagged when feeding it to my son yesterday).Even if you have symptoms, they could come and go. You may hate the smell of your hubby's cologne one week, and not mind it the next. You may feel fatigued for three days straight, then suddenly feel like you could run a marathon. You just never know! LOLBelieve me, you'll start feeling little changes in your body before long! And you'll be crying over little things, too! I remember crying about a commercial that showed a man talking about how you should make sure to get checked for diabetes. At the end, he stood up to walk away and he was using a cane because he was blind. He said something like "I wish I had" . I started sobbing uncontrollably when I realized he was blind. My poor hubby had to witness the whole thing. I just looked at him and said "That was sad."  We had a good laugh about it later.Anyway, the emotional, hormonal roller coaster is just beginning. Try to enjoy the ride as much as possible!  :-)

question: Hello, I just got my first BFP this week, on Tuesday.  I'm excited but I still can't believe it as I am not really having any symptoms.  All I have is sore bbs and mild cramps.  Oh I've been sleeping like a champ lately and I get soooo hot, unbereably hot! Hmm and since I've found out my nose is more sensitive and runny.  Other than that, I don't know when I'm supossed to get nauseaus or throw up or hate my husband's perfume.  I have an appt next week for my first u/s and check up,  the preg due date calculator says that my due date is feb 1st.I still can't believe it, I just feel like I'm bound to get af at any time.Hubby surprisingly has not freaked out yet, I think he's happy!
title: Hello I'm due feb 1st, I think.
